Egoism

U tilitarianism is an ethical view that values the utility of goodness in the form of pleasure. So to put it simply, what results in bringing the most amount of pleasure collectively to the masses is the right thing to do and visa versa: the action that brings the least pleasure collectively should not be acted on. This definition is true in classical utilitarianism but utilitarianism comes in many different forms and sizes, so in some types of utilitarianism, the definition is not true. In this chapter, we will focus on classical utilitarianism and one of its early founders, John Stuart Mill. He helped to expand the utilitarian moral framework that the philosopher Jeremy Bentham started. tilitarianism is an ethical view that values the utility of goodness in the form of pleasure.
